meanings.sent1: She agreed to provisionally help with the project until her schedule cleared up.
meanings.sent2: The store was provisionally closed for renovations.
meanings.sent3: The cat provisionally decided to nap on the warm laundry pile.
meanings.sent4: The sun provisionally peeked through the clouds before disappearing again.
meanings.sent5: The teacher provisionally allowed the students to use calculators for the test.

meanings.definition: Subject to further confirmation or modification
meanings.sent1: The team made a provisionally successful plan for the event.
meanings.sent2: The contract was provisionally signed until the terms were finalized.
meanings.sent3: The cake looked provisionally delicious with its colorful frosting.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was provisionally bright, hiding her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The old house appeared provisionally sturdy despite its worn appearance.
